name: Conseil Europ√©en des Jeunes Agriculteurs
goal: CEJA supports and promotes the interests of young farmers at EU-level. Its main aim consists of influencing the EU agricultural policy framework in order to facilitate entry into the sector by young people. CEJA also acts as a platform for discussion, debate, consultation and exchange between young farmers and between the EU institutions and young farmers.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Budget, Climate Action, Consumer Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, Food Safety, Public Health, Research and Technology, Trade, Youth
euInitiatives: Common Agricultural Policy (CAP) implementation and simplification; food safety; origin labelling; GMO dossier; Organic dossier; Investment plan; Trade Agreements; promotion and quality regulation; environment regulation; climate change policy; employment policy; youth employment packages; etc.
